H0.text: It has twice as many protons as electrons in an atom that has a mass of 24 and a nuclear charge of 12.

H1.text: An atom with a mass of 24 and a nuclear charge of 12 has twice as many neutrons as protons.

H2.text: The atom has equal numbers of neutrons and protons because its mass of 24 and nuclear charge of 12 imply 12 protons and 12 neutrons.

H3.text: It has equal numbers of nuclear particles and electrons, which is accurate for an atom with a mass of 24 and a nuclear charge of 12.

A4.text: The mass of an atom is located in the nucleus, consisting of protons and neutrons.

A5.text: In a neutral atom, the number of electrons is equal to the number of protons in the nucleus.
